60 million Americans have signed forced arbitration clauses at work ‚Äî not realizing that doing so prevents survivors of sexual assault & harassment from telling their story.

This week, the House & Senate passed the #EndForcedArbitration Act to ensure survivors‚Äô voices are heard.

It‚Äôs pretty simple: when Members ‚Äî or senior staff ‚Äî have access to classified information, we should not be trading in the stock market on it.

The Ban Conflicted Trading Act has bipartisan and bicameral support. It‚Äôs time to pass it. https://t.co/C6K47QK5rh

The Pentagon has spent $14 TRILLION on military outsourcing since 2001.¬†We hide the real price tag of our wars in contracts with private companies like TransDigm. 

Needless and exorbitant military spending is unacceptable.

The U.S. military‚Äôs reliance on contractors has led to the rise of the ‚Äúcamo economy,‚Äù in which the U.S. government camouflages the costs of war that might reduce public support for it.¬†Defense contractors then profit ‚Äî and profiteer ‚Äî off of wars, so they lobby to prolong them.

Back in 2019, defense contractor TransDigm returned $16.1 million to the Dep. of Defense after we uncovered egregious price-gouging during an @OversightDems hearing.

Today, we held a second hearing to examine an additional $20.8 million that they owe American taxpayers. https://t.co/4ySVkM0qbj

If you're having problems ordering tests to an apartment, try listing your apartment number in the "Street Address" line, instead of the "Apt" line. You could also try looking up exactly how USPS lists your address, and use that format: https://t.co/wg1wnr1E4u

We know some people in apartments are mistakenly getting denied because someone else in your building already ordered tests. In this case, try using a few of the tricks below - and if you still don't have any luck, then use the help desk information above.

Your household can receive up to 4, free at-home COVID tests through the USPS. Order at https://t.co/DJzjDaDLmB or call 1-800-232-0233.

If you're experiencing a difficulty, call their help desk at 1-800-ASK-USPS (1-800-275-8777) or file an inquiry online: https://t.co/4ddfAWcIfr

Dr. King didn't shrink from controversy. He spoke openly about American imperialism, unionization and labor rights, economic issues, and more. He was targeted, even called a 'communist' because of it.

It's on all of us to pick up where he left off. https://t.co/Ry6BrLZEnT
Violating a place of worship is a uniquely horrific form of terror.  We're thinking of and praying for our Jewish neighbors in this difficult time.
There is no money for housing in the infrastructure bill. Zero. We have to pass the Build Back Better Act. https://t.co/OTFteF8lL8

The Senate MUST end the filibuster and pass voting rights legislation. Our democracy depends on it.

19 states passed laws that restrict the right to vote in 2021, disenfranchising millions of Americans. How many more will follow suit this year? We can't wait to find out.

3. The filibuster has been used consistently to defeat civil rights. Of the 30 measures defeated by the filibuster from 1917 and 1994, exactly half addressed civil rights. And, as recently as 2020, the filibuster was used to delay an anti-lynching bill. 
https://t.co/jOLh9XdUQX

2. Between 1969 and 2014, the filibuster was reformed 161 times. 

So the idea of creating an exception in the filibuster for voting rights or civil rights legislation ‚Äî as many are now asking for ‚Äî isn't new or radical. 
https://t.co/hifXi7roXB

3 insane but true facts about the filibuster:

1. The Founders didn't create the filibuster, and many directly opposed it. The Senate was designed and initially operated with simple-majority rule. The filibuster was essentially a mistake.
https://t.co/fll0RPGAtR

The pollution from coal plants has long contaminated the groundwater our children drink and the air they breathe. The EPA‚Äôs announcement that they will now be enforcing stronger regulations against coal ash facilities is an overdue and welcome development. https://t.co/BLH0X84Uq6
This isn‚Äôt a coincidence. We can‚Äôt dismiss house/ apartment fires as ‚Äòaccidents.‚Äô This is what a housing crisis looks like. https://t.co/dBmrxk8LnA

The mission of the International Monetary Fund is to help balance the global economy‚Äôs deeply unequal recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic. To help global economies recover from the COVID-19 pandemic, we should eliminate the surcharge policy.

Today, with @RepJayapal and @RepChuyGarcia, we urged @SecYellen to eliminate the International Monetary Fund‚Äôs surcharge policy.

This policy requires countries facing debt problems and financial distress to pay additional fees, making their financial situation worse. https://t.co/2KEf13HBke

What do we do now? Democratic leaders have real tools they must use. Senate must reconvene & force Manchin to vote on BBB. And, they need to change the Senate culture, starting with filibuster. POTUS also needs to use his exec authority to fullest extent on student debt & more.

How did BBB get here? In part, it's because the way the Senate runs is fundamentally undemocratic. It gives more power to states with fewer people, and there's an 'old boys club' culture that emboldens Senators to kill bills on TV rather than actually go on record with a vote https://t.co/KcODenF0mU

@tuckerjt1967 This is allowed at the state and local level as well - though some law enforcement agencies are making efforts at reform. 

Here's a look at how civil forfeiture worked in Philadelphia; https://t.co/nzocvzb90q

Civil forfeiture disproportionately hurts low-income, people of color who don't have the resources to fight it. 

It requires little evidence, and presumes guilty until proven innocent.  

It is fundamentally unjust and it needs to end.

In the case of Ms. Harris, who spoke at a recent @OversightDems hearing, law enforcement took her car and didn't provide any explanation for 5 years.  

They then gave her just 21 days to respond, and until she got pro bono help, she was ready to give up the car b/c of the fees.

'Civil asset forfeiture' is so unjust, many don‚Äôt realize its possible. 

Law enforcement can seize property, like a car or home, without charging a crime or going to court. They only need suspicion the property is related to a crime. They can then sell the property & keep the $ https://t.co/x3gqnfH3rU
So today, we're joining @RepChuyGarcia and others to urge the FDIC to ignore Chair McWilliam's clearly illegal action and carry out its planned review. https://t.co/nAh0preVSI

The FDIC Chair moved to deny a review of its policy on bank mergers, even after a majority of the FDIC board voted in favor. 

Mergers can hurt consumers, small business & make our economy less stable -- this is a critical topic for federal regulators to consider. (1/2)

Our 4th amendment regulates inaugural committees - imposing disclosure requirements; prohibiting donations from foreign nationals, shadow groups & corporations; and prohibiting personal use of committee resources.

We‚Äôre happy to see all of these amendments pass The House today.
The third amendment would regulate legal defense funds. While legal defense funds are regulated for Members of Congress, they are currently not regulated at all for the executive branch.
Our second amendment codifies the ‚ÄòBiden Ethics Pledge,‚Äô which was unprecedented in its strength. The amendment ensures no future president can revoke it.

Today, the House passed the Protecting Democracy Act, which included four of our amendments.

Our first amendment expands the definition of nepotism to include the office of the president.  Currently, the definition only applies to federal agencies.üßµ

We're also proud to have the support of @RepAdamSchiff on this amendment. 

Many of our other colleagues have also already taken a stand in support of this change because, in 2010, the House passed a virtually identical amendment.

This amendment doesn't give GAO any new power, just restores the authority Congress always intended. 

We also drafted this with the intelligence community, who want to protect their important work & resources from abuse, especially after Trump tried repeatedly to do just that.

.@USGAO has the authority to conduct oversight of all federal agencies. However, most U.S. intelligence agencies don't fully cooperate. 

Today, we introduced an amendment to put that to an end. GAO should be able to fulfill its mission of rooting out waste, fraud and abuse. https://t.co/7lOl9E3Zwb

It's simple. If you threaten or incite racist rhetoric against a colleague in Congress, you should not get to sit on committees. 

We must hold Rep. Boebert accountable. When we inconsistently apply consequences to bigotry, we invite more people to test these boundaries. https://t.co/uj3aHlu8Ot

One-third of our childcare workforce is immigrants. We could not care for our children without immigrants. The Senate must ignore the advisory opinion of an unelected parliamentarian and put the needs of this country and all its people first. https://t.co/0YUivgt9P9

Now is the time to pass a pathway to citizenship.

Senators are pointing to the Parliamentarian's opinion that it can‚Äôt be included under reconciliation in Build Back Better. But the Parliamentarian is unelected, and her ruling is only a recommendation. 

The Senate must act. https://t.co/8C7vTYazzH

The cost of caring for relatives with disabilities can bring families to the brink of bankruptcy.

We owe it to them to examine how to prevent that from happening.

Watch tomorrow‚Äôs hearing at 11am ET to learn about the economic challenges of #FamilyCare. https://t.co/tfnJOsPPN5

We sent a letter to @FEMA with @RepBowman asking them to provide additional aid to victims of Hurricane Ida.

FEMA aid has been insufficient, and in some cases, non-existent. Nearly 10,000 applications for disaster relief in Queens & the Bronx were denied. We need to do better. https://t.co/coHzCqFySX

No person should have to go into debt - crushing debt - in order to get an education. It‚Äôs wrong, it‚Äôs backwards, and it doesn‚Äôt help us as a country. 

We have a moral obligation, an economic obligation, a political obligation to cancel student debt.

Let‚Äôs stop these ridiculous articles that 'young people are killing diamond rings' and 'they're not buying houses' and 'they're killing this industry' or 'we're not having children.' 

It's because we're being crushed by immoral debt.

Let‚Äôs stop advancing this narrative that student loan debt is for the privileged. 

Do we really think a billionaire‚Äôs child is taking out student loans? 

First-generation college students are twice as likely to report they are behind in making student loan payments. https://t.co/KyGnrJCjNq

As we continue to advocate for the decriminalization and legalization of marijuana, this bill will provide needed resources to expunge drug charges that continue to hold back Americans - disproportionately people of color - from employment, housing and other opportunity.

Reforming cannabis law is not a partisan issue. Americans in both parties overwhelming support it. So, we just introduced a bipartisan bill with @RepDaveJoyce to encourage localities to expunge cannabis offenses.

https://t.co/Ha5TTnKlWh

Rep. AOC secured $10 billion for high-speed rail. This comes after we called for additional funding for high-speed rail in June w/ @SenMarkey, @SenGillibrand, @RepJimCosta & @RepMoulton. The $ will improve our environment, reduce inequity, and help grow cities across the nation.

In 2020, we led a successful vote in the House to repeal the Faircloth Amendment, which prevents building more public housing in the US. Due to the leadership of Rep. AOC & @RepMaxineWaters, new housing funding available through BBB will not be subject to the Faircloth Amendment.

Build Back Better also includes $65 billion for public housing. These funds could be used to clear the New York City Housing Authority‚Äôs maintenance backlog, or for green retrofits and resilience building

In April, we introduced the Civilian Climate Corps with @SenMarkey. Build Back Better allocates $30 billion in funding for the creation of a new Civilian Climate Corps, which would create 300,000 green, good-paying, union jobs.

On Friday, the House passed Build Back Better. So, what‚Äôs in it? Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez successfully fought for the creation of the Civilian Climate Corps as well as funding for public housing and high speed rail. Here‚Äôs what this means: üßµ

@RepMaloney @RepRaskin More than 75% of individuals in custody haven't been convicted of a crime, and are confined in unsafe conditions simply because they cannot afford cash bail. Condemning thousands of individuals to languish in such environments as they await trial is unacceptable.

Today, we sent a letter w/ @RepMaloney & @RepRaskin to NYC's 5 District Attorneys requesting information on excessive bail in the NYC court system. When prosecutors seek excessive cash bail, it results in increased rates of incarceration ‚Äî particularly for low-income defendants. https://t.co/x9cTOx3zo8
